required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Developing Text-based Support for Parents of Adolescents After an Emergency Department Visit
clinical_study.official_title: Developing Text-based Support for Parents of Suicidal Adolescents After Emergency Department Visits: A Multi-component Intervention Pilot

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers seek to develop a text message intervention for caregivers of adolescents at elevated suicide risk following discharge from emergency department (ED) care.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: There are 3 arms: control and 2 intervention arms. One of the intervention arms includes further twice daily (within-person) randomizations.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of eligible participants who agree to participate in the study
Percentage of participants who complete follow-up assessments
Percentages of participants randomized to the intervention who remain active (i.e. do not request to stop receiving messages) (Texting arms only)
Participating parents' satisfaction with the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measured using the Modified Client Satisfaction Questionnaire (CSQ) with a range of 1-4 with higher scores indicating greater satisfaction

arm_group.description: The A-F texting component will include content consistent with best-practice recommendations for parents to buffer youth against suicide risk.

arm_group.arm_group_label: A-F texting plus P-F texting component
arm_group.description: A-F texting plus P-F texting component arm includes the A-F component, as above, and P-F component. The P-F component includes an embedded micro-randomized trial (MRT) involving two daily randomizations to P-F message vs. no message conditions for the duration of the 6-week intervention. Participants who are randomized to this arm will be randomized twice each day (morning and evening) to either receive or not receive the P-F message at each randomization.

intervention.description: Over the course of the 6-week intervention parents in the A-F condition will receive 1 message each day.
intervention.arm_group_label: A-F texting plus P-F texting component

intervention.description: Over the course of the 6 week intervention, parents will receive between 1-2 messages, depending on randomization (in addition to A-F component messages)
intervention.arm_group_label: A-F texting plus P-F texting component

criteria.textblock:
Parent eligibility:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parent of eligible teen
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not owning a cell phone with text messaging capability.
Teen eligibility:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recent suicidal ideation (within last 2 weeks) and/or suicide attempt within the last month.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Youth with severe cognitive impairment or altered mental status (e.g., psychosis, manic state)
- Youth with severe aggression/agitation
- No availability of a legal guardian

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Department of Psychiatry, University of Michigan
